title: 3-Ingredient Japanese Cheesecake Recipe
description: This Japanese cheesecake, made with cream cheese, white chocolate, egg yolks, and whisked egg whites, is an irresistible, light, and airy dessert.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Cheesecake Recipes 3-Ingredient Japanese Cheesecake 4.6 (25) 16 Reviews 12 Photos This Japanese cheesecake has a golden baked top with a fluffy soufflé-like texture. It's easy to make with cream cheese, melted white chocolate, egg yolks, and beaten egg whites to create its signature light and airy texture. Submitted by anna77 Updated on March 31, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 12 12 12 12 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 4 hrs 15 mins Total Time: 5 hrs Servings: 8 Yield: 1 (9-inch) cheesecake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (4 ounce) bar white chocolate, chopped ½ cup cream cheese, softened 3 large eggs, separated Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan with parchment paper. Place white chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes. Remove and allow to cool slightly. Mix in cream cheese and egg yolks until well combined. Beat egg whites in a large glass, metal, or ceramic bowl with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Fold in cooled white chocolate mixture. Pour into the prepared springform pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and bake for 15 minutes. Turn the oven off, leaving cheesecake inside for 15 more minutes. Remove cheesecake from the oven and allow to cool completely at room temperature, about 1 hour. Chill before serving, about 3 hours. Cook’s Note Serve as-is or with a drizzle of puréed berries.Leftovers will keep well in the fridge for a few days. I Made It Print 109 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 151 Calories 11g Fat 9g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 151 % Daily Value * Total Fat 11g 14% Saturated Fat 6g 32% Cholesterol 80mg 27% Sodium 79mg 3% Total Carbohydrate 9g 3% Total Sugars 9g Protein 4g 8% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 49mg 4% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 80mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of 3-Ingredient Japanese Cheesecake 01 of 12 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 12 Photo by  zsethna86 03/21/2021 03 of 12 Photo by  Alicia 11/03/2020 I made this for my sister who is gluten free and also tried it myself and it was delicious. I love white chocolate and whipping the egg whites made for an extremely fluffy dessert. I added chocolate chips to the recipe per her request and will def make this again wether it be for her or someone else sensitive to gluten. 04 of 12 Photo by  Kerry Webster 10/21/2020 05 of 12 Photo by  Tamaira Brown 06/10/2020 it's good. not a form of Japanese cheese cake I'm familiar with but very good. kind of like a cheese cake pizza due to how flat and firm yet spongy it is ,though still has a good texture. was very yummy but also on the eggy side to taste. mine came out just like the picture but I used an 8 in pan. great tasty treat! 06 of 12 Photo by  Gryphon 10/27/2019 07 of 12 Photo by  Loretta Sandoval 07/05/2019 08 of 12 Photo by  Loretta Sandoval 07/05/2019 09 of 12 Photo by  Layla Janzen 02/18/2019 10 of 12 Photo by  christopher archer 01/17/2019 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Gluten Free Pumpkin Cheesecake 21 Ratings Banana Chocolate Creamed Cashew Cake 3 Ratings Low-Carb, Sugar-Free Instant Pot Cheesecake 12 Ratings Keto Mini Pumpkin-Pecan Cheesecakes 1 Rating Chocolate Cheesecake 116 Ratings Baileys Cheesecake 4 Ratings Blueberry Cheesecake 119 Ratings Sopapilla Cheesecake Pie 2,685 Ratings Cheesecake Cupcakes 197 Ratings Oreo Mini Cheesecakes 21 Ratings Spiderweb Pumpkin Cheesecake 8 Ratings Vegan Mars Bar Cheesecake 1 Rating The Best Chocolate Cheesecake 259 Ratings Low-Carb Cheesecake 2 Ratings Keto Raspberry Cheesecake 15 Ratings No-Bake Cheesecake with Condensed Milk 24 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan with parchment paper.;Place white chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes. Remove and allow to cool slightly. Mix in cream cheese and egg yolks until well combined.;Beat egg whites in a large glass, metal, or ceramic bowl with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Fold in cooled white chocolate mixture. Pour into the prepared springform pan.;Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and bake for 15 minutes. Turn the oven off, leaving cheesecake inside for 15 more minutes.;Remove cheesecake from the oven and allow to cool completely at room temperature, about 1 hour. Chill before serving, about 3 hours.
